---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [ ] depends on: #14520

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3e25c552db](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14482/commits/3e25c552dbac2e1dd2cb796b1f5f566908aaf816)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.CategoryTheory`|1508|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ iff_lTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact`
`+ iff_rTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact`
`+ lTensor_shortComplex_exact`
`+ rTensor_shortComplex_exact`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1b2b82fb-88b9-4837-aa4c-5ce4ca659d84) for commit 32ba554e65112d075b314788173d05fd9279637d.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2c56e275-73ba-4ac0-85b2-6203dce7e0c0) for commit 32f3feb89adc9581f8d7778e0646e19d78c66e70.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/6f0a0eb0-04e6-4205-ac12-d9055efc215b/to/2c56e275-73ba-4ac0-85b2-6203dce7e0c0) against commit 06352df94c59a012c8424d2ce0d5518d108c8714.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14520~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9922524057/job/27411686454)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9922524057/job/27411686586)

Could you use https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Homology/ShortComplex/Exact.html instead? (It is likely that the notion from `Algebra.Homology.Exact` will be removed eventually. Actually, your PR reminds me that I should remove it...)
I am not very proficient in the homological algebra part of library. Can you check if you like the changes now please?
The PR has gotten quite big after the change, if necessary I will split it.
It seems to me that these lemmas are already in the file `Algebra.Homology.ShortComplex.ModuleCat`.
(If this is needed, note also that in #14520, I introduce a lemma which relates `Function.Exact` and  `ShortComplex.Exact` in the category of modules.)
Thanks! That will save may rewrites `LinearMap.exact_iff`

After you have obtained `iff_lTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact`, I believe that the rest should be obtained from a (missing) API about additive functors between abelian categories: they preserve exactness iff they preserves both finite limits and colimits. Then, I think we should develop this API for general characterizations of left exact/right exact/exact functors between abelian categories in terms of their behaviour on exact short complexes.

A suggestion is to keep in this PR only the beginning of the file until `iff_rTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact`. Then, depending on how you feel about the general API I am suggesting above, you may do it, or I may do it if you prefer.
I will try to open a PR about this suggestion this week!
I have removed everything else except `iff_rTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact ` and above. I think I will wait for #14520 to golf the proof a bit more

> A suggestion is to keep in this PR only the beginning of the file until `iff_rTensor_preserves_shortComplex_exact`. Then, depending on how you feel about the general API I am suggesting above, you may do it, or I may do it if you prefer.

I would want to use this as an opportunity to learn more about the homological part of the library, but my code would probably not be optimal. If you think it would be more efficient to open the PR yourself, I wouldn't mind either.
Please do it!

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun _ _ => lTensor_shortComplex_exact _ _, fun H => iff_lTensor_exact.2 $
```

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun _ _ => rTensor_shortComplex_exact _ _, fun H => iff_rTensor_exact.2 $
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Flat): a module is flat iff tensoring preserves exact sequences
